div.p: SFSP Meal Service - Press Release

div.jsaction: click:cOuCgd; mousedown:UX7yZ; mouseup:lbsD7e; mouseenter:tfO1Yc; mouseleave:JywGue; focus:AHmuwe; blur:O22p3e; contextmenu:mg9Pef;

div.p: Science with Kyle

div.jsaction: click:cOuCgd; mousedown:UX7yZ; mouseup:lbsD7e; mouseenter:tfO1Yc; mouseleave:JywGue; focus:AHmuwe; blur:O22p3e; contextmenu:mg9Pef;

div.p: High School Daily Challenge

span.style: font-family: Lato;
span.strong: Q: What can you tell me about the recent changes to online learning for high school students?

div.p: A: All High School learning opportunities are now being distributed through Google Classroom directly to students. Google Classroom allows interaction between teachers and students to deliver content and to assign/turn in work. Every teacher has a Classroom set up for each of their courses and will be delivering content through that platform. Students should be logging into their school gmail account daily and then will have access to all of their classes. Parents can be given access to their childrens classes as well. Just e-mail the teacher and ask to be added.

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

div.p: All high school teachers will be holding virtual office hours at least once a week. These will be done through Zoom or Google Meet. Teachers will send a link for those sessions to students through Google Classroom. Students can jump in and out of those sessions as they wish. Office hours will be staggered throughout the week so that no more than 2 teachers will be having office hours at the same time. These will be informal sessions for students to ask questions, get feedback, or just interact with teachers in general. Parents are welcome to participate in office hour visits with your student.

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

div.p: At this time, due to Department of Education guidelines, learning opportunities provided are not required but are highly encouraged for the learning and success of our students. We are hoping soon to have all Department of Education guidelines met so that we can start requiring student work to be done. We will keep you updated as this progresses.

span.style: font-family: Lato;
span.strong: Q:

span.style: font-family: Lato; font-size: 15px; font-style: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;
span.strong: Will we be back at school this semester?

span.style: font-family: Lato; font-size: 15px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

div.p: A: On April 2, 2020, Governor Reynolds held a press conference and extended the closure of Iowa Schools through April 30, 2020. We are aware that some states have made decisions to postpone the remainder of their school year and strictly provide virtual learning opportunities. We will follow the recommendations of State and Government agencies.

span.style: font-family: Lato;
span.strong: Q:

span.style: font-family: Lato; font-size: 15px; font-style: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;
span.strong: Will students get credit for the time they missed between

span.style: font-family: Lato;
span.strong: March

span.style: font-family: Lato; font-size: 15px; font-style: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;
font-family: Lato;
span.strong: April 30

span.style: font-family: Lato; font-size: 15px; font-style: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;
span.strong: , 2020 of the Spring Semester?

span.style: font-family: Lato; font-size: 15px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

div.p: A: YES! Students will NOT be penalized for time missed during mandatory shutdown.

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0; white-space: normal;

span.style: font-family: Lato;
span.strong: Q:

span.style: font-family: Lato; font-size: 15px; font-style: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;
span.strong: Why are all school facilities closed, including outside facilities like the track and ball fields?

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0; white-space: normal;

div.p: A: President Trumps social distancing initiative and the recommendation from Governor Reynolds to close all schools until April 30 effectively closed all of our facilities. We are taking a proactive stance in modeling social distancing to help eliminate the spread of COVID-19. This is a consistent approach that many counties and school districts are taking at this time in response to the COVID-19 exposure concerns. We are taking a proactive approach to limit the possibility of 10 or more people gathering to use our outside facilities to abide by the social distancing initiative.

span.style: font-family: Lato;
span.strong: Q:

span.style: font-family: Lato; font-size: 15px; font-style: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;
span.strong: Will there be Spring activities offered this year? What about Summer practices?

span.style: font-family: Lato; font-size: 15px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

div.p: A: At this time the girls and boys athletic unions, music, and speech associations have postponed all activities until April 30. At this point summer practices will begin at the usual time in mid-May.

span.style: font-family: Lato;
span.strong: Q:

span.style: font-family: Lato; font-size: 15px; font-style: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;
span.strong: Will Ridge View High School have Prom on April 25th?

span.style: font-family: Lato; font-size: 15px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

div.p: A: No. At this time Prom is NOT cancelled. We will evaluate the likelihood of Prom over the next couple weeks. We know this leaves students in a bind if they havent bought a dress or reserved a tux. But this is the best answer I have at this time.

span.style: font-family: Lato;
span.strong: Q:

span.style: font-family: Lato; font-size: 15px; font-style: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;
span.strong: Will seniors be able to graduate this year?

div.p: A: YES! Seniors will be able to graduate this semester! We will be reviewing seniors and their progress on an individual basis. We will encourage flexibility and latitude as we move through these difficult times.

span.style: font-family: Lato;
span.strong: Q:

span.style: font-family: Lato; font-size: 15px; font-style: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;
span.strong: Will there be a graduation ceremony?

span.style: font-family: Lato; font-size: 15px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

div.p: A: We are planning on our normal graduation ceremony. Now, that may be in May if it is safe to do so, or it may be later in the summer when it is safer to have large groups in the gym.

span.style: font-family: Lato;
span.strong: Q:

span.style: font-family: Lato; font-size: 15px; font-style: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;
span.strong: Will scholarships still be awarded to students that applied for them?

span.style: font-family: Lato; font-size: 15px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

div.p: A: Yes. All seniors should have received an e-mail from Mrs. Todd about scholarships, deadlines, and how to get applications completed. Please check your school e-mail for that information or e-mail Mrs. Todd with any questions.

span.style: font-family: Lato;
span.strong: Q:

span.style: font-family: Lato; font-size: 15px; font-style: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;
span.strong: Will there be a senior awards ceremony?

span.style: font-family: Lato; font-size: 15px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

div.p: A: We are planning on having senior awards night.

span.style: font-family: Lato;
span.strong: Q:

span.style: font-family: Lato; font-size: 15px; font-style: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;
span.strong: Will Spring Music Concerts/Programs take place?

span.style: font-family: Lato; font-size: 15px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

div.p: A: Right now we are planning on all elementary and middle school concerts taking place. We may need to reschedule them to give the students time to practice and rehearse for the concert/program.

span.style: font-family: Lato;
span.strong: Q:

span.style: font-family: Lato; font-size: 15px; font-style: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;
span.strong: Will students get credit for the classes they are in?

span.style: font-family: Lato; font-size: 15px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

div.p: A: Short answer is yes. We will be working with the high school staff to address this dilemma for all students. The high school staff and administration will be discussing how we move forward. We will encourage flexibility and latitude as we move through these challenging situations.

span.style: font-family: Lato;
span.strong: Q:

span.style: font-family: Lato; font-size: 15px; font-style: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;
span.strong: How will I schedule for 2020-2021 classes, including senior college classes?

div.p: A: All students in grades 9-11 will be receiving an email from Mrs. Todd with instructions and scheduling request forms for next year's classes. You will need to make an electronic copy of the form, complete it, and then share it back with Mrs. Todd. If you have any questions, email Mrs. Todd.

span.style: font-family: Lato;
span.strong: Q:

span.style: font-family: Lato; font-size: 15px; font-style: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;
span.strong: What will happen to the spring and summer sessions of Drivers Education?

span.style: font-family: Lato; font-size: 15px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

div.p: A: Following all CDC and IDPH recommendations, all Driver's Education courses are also currently suspended from taking place this spring. We must also follow the Department of Transportation guidelines for the amount of class time and driving time required, as those DOT requirements have not been waived. We will contact the enrolled students when the course suspension is ended and available again. Therefore, we do not know when summer Driver's Education courses will start again.

span.style: font-family: Lato;
span.strong: Q: What is the new date for Galva-Holstein Preschool registration

span.style: font-family: Lato; font-size: 15px; font-style: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;
font-family: Lato; font-size: 15px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

div.p: A: We will schedule a new date as soon as classes begin again/or as soon as quarantines have been lifted. We will be sure to communicate this out through social media and school announcements.

span.style: font-family: Lato;
span.strong: Q: What is the new date for Kindergarten Round-up

span.style: font-family: Lato; font-size: 15px; font-style: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;
font-family: Lato; font-size: 15px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

div.p: A: We will schedule a new date as soon as classes begin again/or as soon as quarantines have been lifted. We will be sure to communicate this out through social media and school announcements.

span.style: font-family: Lato;
span.strong: Q:

span.style: font-family: Lato; font-size: 15px; font-style: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;
span.strong: What can communities and families do to build protective capacity during this time

span.style: font-family: Lato;

div.p: A: Go for a walk, run or bike ride in a low traffic area

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0; white-space: normal;

span.style: font-family: Lato; font-size: 15px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: Check in by phone, skype or social media with your neighbors, friend and family

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0; white-space: normal;

span.style: font-family: Lato; font-size: 15px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: Enjoy fun time with your child-read a book, do crafts, or make a blanket fort

span.style: font-family: Lato; font-size: 15px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: underline; vertical-align: baseline;

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0; white-space: normal;

span.style: font-family: Lato; font-size: 15px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: Get a virtual parent group together (formal or informal) to provide support and share ideas

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0; white-space: normal;

span.style: font-family: Lato; font-size: 15px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: Highlight the positive work going on in your community-there are so many innovative and impactful efforts going on right now-With all of the scary headlines it is important to focus on messages of hope and resilience.

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0; white-space: normal;
margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0; white-space: normal;

span.style: font-family: Lato;
span.strong: Q:

span.style: font-family: Lato; font-size: 15px; font-style: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;
span.strong: Is there someone I can still talk to about some personal things?

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 48px; text-align: justify; text-indent: -48px; white-space: normal;

div.p: A: Here are some resources that families may use:

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0; white-space: normal;
margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0; white-space: normal;

span.style: font-family: Lato; font-size: 15px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: Season's Center: 1-800-242-5101. They also have a crisis line at 844-345-4569

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0; white-space: normal;

span.style: font-family: Lato; font-size: 15px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0; white-space: normal;

span.style: font-family: Lato; font-size: 15px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0; white-space: normal;

div.p: Family Resources for Food and Financial Assistance or Mental Health Referral:

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0; white-space: normal;

span.style: font-family: Lato; font-size: 15px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: Mid Sioux in Cherokee and Ida Counties 712-225-3322 or 800-859-2025

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: justify; text-indent: 0; white-space: normal;

span.style: font-family: Lato; font-size: 15px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Lato;
span.strong: Q: How can I sign up for free breakfasts and lunches for my children during this time when school isn't in session?

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

div.p: A: Everyone 18 and under are eligible for free lunches and breakfasts. Please be respectful and order your meals in advance. More information is available here: https://rvraptors.org/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/lunch-letter-update.pdf or contact G-H Food Service Director Randa Hoover at rhoover@rvraptors.org or S-C Food Service Director Jesse Barnett at jbarnett@rvraptors.org.

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: top: -12px
